AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: a sparsely traveled road with a reputation as a smuggling route, used by smugglers, connected to U.S. 59, where vehicles drop off illegal aliens between the Freer immigration checkpoint and Bruni, and a point where aliens walk east to Highway 16, part of a route avoiding checkpoints via FM 2050, U.S. 59, and U.S. 359, location of the traffic stop in the instant case, scene of the traffic stop involving IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., location where Agent Trevino encountered illegals in a white sedan, part of an alternative smuggling route, a paved road with two lanes, location of ranches and oil fields, average daily traffic data discussed in court, a narrow road with sharp turns, location of a traffic stop, adjacent to the Border Patrol station parking lot, used for drop-offs of illegal aliens, location where vehicles drop off illegal aliens, mostly used by ranchers and oil trucks, followed by Agent Jorge Luis Trevino, near the wind farm, connection between U.S. 359 and U.S. 59, a road where the white vehicle was going on and off, has intersections with Mills Bennett Road, San Pablo Road, and Santo Nino Road, location where Agent Trevino initiated a stop of the white vehicle, location of traffic stop
